text: Suriname competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Suriname entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Irvin Hoost |align=left|50 m butterfly |25.97 |66 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |colspan=2| |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Renzo Tjon-A- Joe |align=left|50 m freestyle |22.33 |=21 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |49.85 |39 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left|Xiomara Getrouw |align=left|50 m backstroke |31.42 |34 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Evita Leter |align=left|50 m breaststroke |34.58 |41 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:20.89 |51 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Suriname at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
